facts.fact: Michael Jackson's sixth studio album, 'Thriller', was released on November 30, 1982.
'Human Nature' is the fifth single from the album 'Thriller'.
'Thriller' became the world's best-selling album of all time, with over 70 million copies sold.
The album 'Thriller' produced seven top-ten singles, a record at the time.

sources.title: Revisiting how Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' era set the pop industry ...
sources.snippet: Four months prior to that taping, on November 30, 1982, Michael Jackson released his sixth studio album, Thriller, under Epic Records of CBS Columbia. The LP’s lead single, a duet with Paul McCartney called “The Girl Is Mine,” commenced the era on October 18, immediately making a profound statement. Here, we had a baton passing—albeit, represented by a loopy argument over a “doggone” playgirl—from a former Beatle of a group that many heralded as contemporary pop music’s innovators, to a black man who would soon be knighted the genre’s overall King. sources.title: Human Nature (Michael Jackson song)
sources.snippet: "Human Nature" is a song performed by American singer-songwriter Michael Jackson, and it is the fifth single from his sixth solo album, Thriller "Thriller (album)"). The track was produced by Quincy Jones and performed by some band members of Toto "Toto (band)") with Jackson providing vocals.

sources.title: Thriller (album) - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Jackson reunited with Off the Wall producer Quincy Jones to record his sixth studio album, his second under the Epic label. They worked together on 30 songs, nine of which were included on the album. Thriller was recorded at Westlake Recording Studios in Los Angeles, California, with a production budget of $750,000. The recording commenced on April 14, 1982, at noon with Jackson and Paul McCartney recording "The Girl Is Mine"; it was completed on the final day of mixing, November 8, 1982. Several members of the band Toto "Toto (band)") were involved in the album's recording and production. Jac

sources.title: Thriller 25 - Wikipedia
sources.snippet:
## Background

[edit]

Jackson released his sixth studio album, Thriller "Thriller (Michael Jackson album)"), on November 30, 1982. With sales estimated to be over 70 million copies worldwide, Thriller became the world's best-selling album of all time; the album was the first in history to yield seven top-ten singles. The success of Thriller put Jackson into the dominating position of pop music, becoming an international pop-cultural icon. [...] | Thriller 25 |

sources.title: King of Pop (album) - Michael Jackson Wiki | Fandom
sources.snippet:
King of Pop is a compilation album by American singer-songwriter Michael Jackson, released through Epic Records on August 22, 2008, in commemoration of his 50th birthday. The album title comes from the honorific title Jackson acquired approximately 2 decades earlier.

Due to the system where fans from each country can vote on which songs would appear on that country's edition of the album, the track listings vary across countries.
